ch.bfh.roboticsLab.yellow

Class Telecommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.roboticsLab.yellow.Telecommand

  • public class Telecommand
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds a complete Yellow telecommand packet in a Java object.
    Author:
    gabriel.gruener@bfh.ch
    See Also:
    yellow.proto

      Telecommand()

    • Method Detail

      • setState

        public void setState(StateName state)
        Set the desired state for this command.

      • getState

        public StateName getState()
        Retrieve the desired state of this command.

      • setVelocities

        public void setVelocities(float linearSpeed,
                          float angularSpeed)
        Set the desired velocities parameters for this command. To be used in combination with states MANUAL or AUTO_*.
        Parameters:
        linearSpeed - Desired linear speed.
        angularSpeed - Desired angular speed.

      • getVelocities

        public float[] getVelocities()
        Retrieve the velocity parameters of this command.
        Returns:
        Array with linear then angular speed values. Null if not set.

      • setCorrectedPose

        public void setCorrectedPose(float x,
                             float y,
                             float alpha)
        Set the corrected pose parameters for this command. To be used when correcting the estimated pose of the robot.
        Parameters:
        x - Corrected x coordinate [m].
        y - Corrected y coordinate [m].
        alpha - Corrected alpha coordinate [rad].

      • getCorrectedPose

        public float[] getCorrectedPose()
        Retrieve the corrected pose parameters of this command.
        Returns:
        Array with x, y, alpha values. Null if not set.

      • setDesiredPose

        public void setDesiredPose(float x,
                           float y,
                           float alpha)
        Set the desired pose parameters for this command. To be used only in state AUTO_POSITION.
        Parameters:
        x - Desired x coordinate [m].
        y - Desired y coordinate [m].
        alpha - Desired alpha coordinate [rad].

      • getDesiredPosePose

        public float[] getDesiredPosePose()
        Retrieve the desired pose parameters of this command.
        Returns:
        Array with x, y, alpha values. Null if not set.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
